result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose M Bocanegra Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions for work, work search and treatment
IF REVOKED 104 days credit

miscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, random UA's

No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia

No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

No contact with Target store listed in the criminal complaint

Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling
Restitution for Target is to be paid as a condition of probation and is to be paid before costs or fees

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: CONDITION TIME - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM Defendant Jose M Bocanegra Diaz in court, in custody.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Jose M Bocanegra Diaz. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  

Defendant enters a guilty plea to sole count. Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant and finds them guilty of sole count. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
9 Months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS/RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH AND TREATMENT.  (Credit - 104 days). 

Term of Probation: 2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with: Target store listed in criminal complaint. 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

RESTITUTION:  $529.99, paid to Target (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 60 days, Straight Time, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.   

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

COURT DENIES REQUEST FOR EXPUNCTION.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Letter dated 08/30/2022, filed by Atty Carlson, requesting a Plea and Sentencing Hearing

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 08/31/2022 - Okay to scheduled as requested.**
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Response from the Clerk dated 08/29/2022 in regards to Defendant's request for a Bail modification

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 08/23/2022 requesting a Bail modification

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 08/29/2022 - Defendant needs to work with their Attorney to file the proper Motion.

9:36 AM Defendant Jose M Bocanegra Diaz in court, in custody.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Jose M Bocanegra Diaz. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Attorney Carlson is in the process of getting discovery and does not yet have an offer from the State. 
Offer is withheld at this time, per the State. Bodycam footage requested in July. 
Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Abigail Kincheloe, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Jose M Bocanegra Diaz in court, in custody, with attorney Brandon K. Carlson. 
Court to Address:  Defense Motion for Bail Modification (Requesting a Signature Bond).

Attorney Carlson presented bail arguments to the court.
State objects to any bail modification - Arguments presented.
Court Denies - Defense Motion for Bail Modification.
Reasons placed on the record.
Bail/bond hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion for Bail Modification, filed by Attorney Carlson.
Hearing on August 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

08:24 AM Defendant Jose M Bocanegra Diaz in court, in custody, with attorney Brandon K. Carlson.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Attorney Brandon Carlson
